name: GraphDataMonkey
short_description: I was introduced to the need to plot current data against data that was obtained from reports or papers.  In many cased this previous data does not exist in a digital form.  Many people set out drawing lines and approximating the values.  A JAVA based app was created (DataTheif III) but since there was no need to theif the data and it apeared that the application died many years ago, a new method of extracting the data was created.  This time written in the dotnet framework, it offers compatibility with Windows machines only.  You can used only numeric axes, but these axes can be either linear or logrithmic.
summary: A graphical tool for extracting data from published graphs
